meanings.definition: Pass or cause to pass easily or gently through or as if through the air.
meanings.sent1: The scent of fresh flowers would waft through the room.
meanings.sent2: The music wafted softly from the speakers.
meanings.sent3: The aroma of baking cookies wafted into the neighbor's yard.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to waft around the room like a gentle breeze.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the wind wafting through the trees was calming.

meanings.sent1: A waft of cool air brushed against my face.
meanings.sent2: I felt a waft of wind as I opened the window.
meanings.sent3: The waft from the fan made the papers on the desk flutter.
meanings.sent4: The waft of the ocean carried the salty smell to our noses.
meanings.sent5: The waft of the breeze brought relief on a hot day.
